text: Always a good pick

Here’s a dumb but effective way to kill the table if you can gain 1 life to start it. 

[[Oathsworn Vampire]] +
[[Bontu’s Monument]] +
[[Phyrexian Altar]]

attachments.fallback: Oathsworn Vampire {1}{B} // Creature — Vampire Knight // Oathsworn Vampire enters the battlefield tapped. // You may cast Oathsworn Vampire from your graveyard if you gained life this turn. // 2/2

Creature — Vampire Knight
Oathsworn Vampire enters the battlefield tapped.
You may cast Oathsworn Vampire from your graveyard if you gained life this turn.
_"My conquistadors are never slain, merely laid to rest." —Queen Miralda the Pious_
*2/2*

text: I am running Altar and the Monument in Teysa, but I didn't put the vampire in because really the Monument is my only source of life gain

Wait, no it doesn't because it's not a cast
Right. That’s the key.
If you originally cast the vamp with Monument out you’re already good to go.

text: Is fine? Is it fair? Is it at all better than a glorified Scepter?
Dies to doom blade
It's a repeatable doom blade, Patrick
Also, I had to fix swipe text because it through your name was Hick.
Doom blade seems like one of poorer things to put under
It's probably an amazing card in an immature meta
Beyond that you're looking to get two-for-one'ed
I can't see this doing any work except for your opponents.
I'd love it if my opponent would pay mana to exile the best instant card in his hand
or even the worst...
Yep
Thanks for the built-in counterspell
But there are absolutely metas I've seen where it would sit there the entire game casting Brainstorms, too
I can see that in an answer-light meta.
<@U3QMCLQQG> does not play in such a meta :wink:
If you're playing in one of those regularly though you don't need advice on whether to run it.
If your meta is still terrified of Kaalia decks you're probably safe running Elite Arcanist
Just put Dramatic Reversal under it - so OP!
I was thinking of using it as a redundancy piece for Scepter in Niv-Mizzet
So we've had closing in on six months with the C17 decks. I remember a few people being super hype on Fractured Identity. That ever pan out?
I hear that's amazing under Elite Anarchist...:smiling_imp:
Dramatic Reversal and/or Paradox Engine makes it go
I've seen FI cast a few times, and it was impactful each time. Actually saw it cast with Rebound from UW Taigam, and that was fun.
It was even more fun when the Tasigur player cast Riftsweeper to get FI out of exile and shuffle it back into the Taigam player's deck.
Beyond that, I really haven't seen it played.
I never thought it was good.
I'm going to check the tape...I'm sure <@U3QMCLQQG> was big on it...
:wink:
I know Patrick liked it and maybe Jason
I still like it, I just don’t have a place for it
not the best card in the world though
Patrick liked it. I didn't like it because it cost 5 and was sorcery speed
downsides aside, [[hive mind]] and [[primal vigor]] make it hilarious

text: If I hear "Hive Mind" one more time...
I still throw side glances at Deadbridge Chant so I'm not gonna talk too much shit about people trying to hard to make bad high cmc cards work
deadbridge spent longer in my meren deck than it should have
<@U3RJ9VDRT> if <@U3QMCLQQG> hears Hive Mind 1 more time, he's turning this conversation around.

Oh Patrick. That's the Deadbridge Chant argument. "It's pretty good if I have these other high cmc cards in play simultaneously and nobody else has mana free, cards in hand, or the ability to draw anything."
I played it in an early build of my Sultai Sidisi zombie build a couple of years ago.
Sulti Sidisi at least has a chance to get something off the mill
Right
It was slow but fun.
6 mana to make a 2/2 isn't great, but it's better than literally every other deck where it's six mana for nothing until next turn maybe
Worst part about Sidisi...
I was a much worse deck builder back then...

I still haven't finished roughing out my attempt at a deck. I've discovered psychologically I have real issues with having the option in my colors to build a deck with the appropriate removal, ramp, draw, etc. but NOT doing so. For example there's just not a lot of ramp options in Talrand, so I run the appropriate rocks and don't worry about the rest. It is what it is, and it doesn't bother me in the least. But when I was messing with Athreos Shadowborn Apostles I really struggled with accepting I was going to have to build a deck that didn't have all the "correct" cards I wanted to run. To get the deck to work you need to accept you can't run all the pieces you'd normally run since the density of Apostles required soaks up those slots.

I'm having the same problem with Sultai Sidisi where there isn't enough room in the deck to run the cards I want to run to feel like I'm building the deck "correct". It's entirely in my head, but it bugs me none the less.
How're you defining "correct" in  your head?
I want x amount of ramp, x amount of draw, x amount of targeted removal, x board wipes, etc

But with Sidisi I also want some top deck manipulation and a higher than normal creature density to ensure I can make tokens off her, plus the token support cards like Doubling Season, Parallel lives, etc.
so, in that case you need less actual ramp and removeal
Right, I just need to accept I can't run some things.
because you’ll be shipping what you don’t want to the other parts of the deck
Bugs me though.
Yeah, I agree with <@U3RJ9VDRT>. I think this comes down to being very solid in your goals and priorities. Perhaps it might help you think of it as sacrificing for theme.

And I think we all need to remind ourselves that decks are living things and that deckbuilding is very iterative. I think we all get hung up on getting the 'correct' build, but have to remember that correct is like achieving enlightenment - you get there, but have to work to keep it.
I've accepted the fact that countermagic is out
Ramp is probably the next thing I'm gonna have to let go
thats the biggest reason why I always advocate to never cut pet cards in first deck lists
run oracle of mul daya
and that new dino
yeah...if you can focus on maintaining card draw and then use creatures that allow you to play additional lands a turn you can get the ramp while staying true to the build.
that would honestly be my focous
in fact, with sidisi, I’d want almost all my draw to be creature based too
I really like that new Oracle of Dino
me too henry
What about the Naga that draws then discards that has Eternalize
Its very good in Sidisi.
I don't have a Sultai deck, so I think I'm going to build Sidisi reanimator.
[[Wayward Swordtooth]] works really well with [[Rhonas]]

sunhome is for the double strike kill!
